sub_title: Technical Manager at ARLANXEO Performance Elastomers
summary:
Customer centric technical service and application development manager with drive to expand beyond borders in a curious, creative, interfacing, collaborative and results driven way. 

Dedicated customer focus with a keen eye for new business opportunities by understanding 'the voice of the customer'. Identifying needs, ideas and market trends, translate these into specifications and into multidisciplinary projects. Establishing relevant product, market and application knowledge for new market and application opportunities. Delivering solutions by introducing the right products and technical knowledge for the market and applications in existing business. 

More than 30 years technical-commercial experience and technical knowledge of diverse performance materials and markets (engineering plastics-high performance fibers-additives-high performance elastomers) in diverse functions with drive to deliver right. 

Proficient in interfacing with teams of different departments, at different levels, with different interests and diverse personalities; connecting people; creating sustainable business relationships and multilevel networks contributing to continuity of the business.

Proven competence in project management: defining, initiating, developing and implementing product and application development projects. Building and leading multiple high performing multidisciplinary project teams in line with company and customers project management guidelines, strategy and business planning. 

Curious and quick learner; creative analytical and problem solving mindset; bridge-builder and cross-pollinator; results driven with an eye for team sensitivities; perseverant, adaptable, loyal, trustful and transparent; well developed people skills and well organized.  
Energetic spider in the web.

rubber, which is designed for peroxide-cured W&C MV-HV insulation. 
Keltan® 2470E based cable compounds are characterized by low compound Mooney 
levels very good processing. This includes good mixing, fast extrusion rates without 
surface melt fracture, excellent control over curing behavior by the type and amount 
of peroxide, good vulcanizate properties, and very low dielectric loss of the final cable 
compound. It shows the highest electrical resistivity level at 90°C and 0.01 Hz, and therefore outperforms low Mooney competitor EPDM grades.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Joyce', 'last_name': 'K.', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Technical Manager at ARLANXEO Performance Elastomers'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Peter', 'last_name': 'Meijers', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Product Development Specialist at ARLANXEO'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Wouter', 'last_name': 'van Meerendonk', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Group leader EPDM Pilot Plant at Lanxess'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Richard', 'last_name': 'Scott', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Partner at Elkington + Fife'}, {'type': 'nonStandardizedContributor', 'first_name': None, 'last_name': None, 'name': 'john beelen', 'headline': None}]}, {'title': 'Assessment Micro Dense Technology and Product Value', 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, 'description': 'Investigate automotive trend: solid profile replacement by light weight solid profile

- Lighter, longer and stronger lengths can increase productivity by up to a factor of three
- Only 4% elongation at break is ideal for demanding, high precision tie-down tasks
- Link dimensions no more than 1.5 times bigger than steel chain at equal strength 
- Available in SK62, SK75, SK78 and DM20 fiber versions for differing strength and for applications under dynamic as well under permanent load ', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Joyce', 'last_name': 'K.', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Technical Manager at ARLANXEO Performance Elastomers'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Dietrich', 'last_name': 'Wienke', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Global Create Program Lead for:  Cranes with Synthetic Hoist Ropes;  Synthetic Link Chains at AVIENT PROTECTIVE MATERIALS B.V. , Geleen (The Netherlands)'}, {'type': 'nonStandardizedContributor', 'first_name': None, 'last_name': None, 'name': 'Roel MarissenChris', 'headline': None}, {'type': 'nonStandardizedContributor', 'first_name': None, 'last_name': None, 'name': 'Chris Dirks', 'headline': None}, {'type': 'nonStandardizedContributor', 'first_name': None, 'last_name': None, 'name': 'René Homminga', 'headline': None}, {'type': 'nonStandardizedContributor', 'first_name': None, 'last_name': None, 'name': 'Astea B.V.', 'headline': None}]}, {'title': 'Flexible high tenacity laminate Valmex® CF10', 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2009}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}}, 'description': 'The flexible high tenacity laminate in fabric door design is to deliver lightweight, durable doors for safe containment through a strategic balance of key factors - lightweight, user-friendly, compliance and high environmental and operational resistance. 

Impressive tensile strength, remarkable impact resistance, and excellent tear and wear properties makes the Nordisk D4000 door tougher and more resistant to puncture and cutting. The best choice for ULD operations struggling with excessive door maintenance costs.
